questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming road conditions and hazards.

questions.question: What does a red octagon sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagon sign is universally used to indicate 'Stop'.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A green traffic light indicates that you can proceed, but must yield to pedestrians and vehicles still in the intersection.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection with no signs or signals?
options: All vehicles must come to a complete stop
questions.explanation: At an intersection with no signs or signals, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: What should you do when approaching a school bus with flashing red lights?
questions.explanation: When a school bus has flashing red lights, drivers must stop and remain stopped until the red lights stop flashing.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on a Texas highway under ideal conditions?
questions.explanation: The maximum speed limit on a Texas highway under ideal conditions is 75 mph, unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: When is it safe to exceed the posted speed limit?
questions.explanation: It is never safe or legal to exceed the posted speed limit.

questions.question: What is the maximum legal parking distance from the curb?
questions.explanation: In Texas, you must park no more than 18 inches from the curb.

questions.question: Is it legal to park in front of a driveway?
options: Only if it's your own driveway
Only with permission from the property owner
questions.explanation: It is illegal to park in front of a driveway in all cases.

questions.question: What should you do when driving in foggy conditions?
questions.explanation: In foggy conditions, you should reduce speed and use low beam headlights.
